intro: Cnidoscolus cajamarcensis, commonly known as the Andean arrowhead, is a herbaceous plant native to the cloud forests of Ecuador and Peru. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves with a waxy surface. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and its roots are often used in traditional medicine. C. cajamarcensis is adapted to high-altitude environments and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in its native habitat.
